definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out

sentences.english: "And I, " returns the sky, "your humble touch. "
sentences.chinese: “而我，”天空答道，“傾慕你的謙恭宛轉。”

sentences.english: In America, Goldman still has legions of admirers.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，高盛公司仍然備受傾慕。

sentences.english: Inclination as well as perversity made the decision easy.
sentences.chinese: 傾慕再加上任性便不難作出決定了。

sentences.english: First, it adore you, ah, 23 the skin so well.
sentences.chinese: 首先，很傾慕你啊，23了皮膚這麼好。

sentences.english: But he has long been an admirer of Trezeguet.
sentences.chinese: 但是，衆所周知他對特雷澤蓋已經“傾慕已久”。

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
